Agent Guide.title: Navigation and Dashboard
Agent Guide.description: Navigate faster between the various sections in your helpdesk with the icon-based navigation panel and stay on top of helpdesk metrics that matter the most to you. Read more about team dashboards here.

Agent Guide.title: Setting up your support email in Gmail - video guide
Agent Guide.description:
Don’t let emails slip through the cracks! With Freshdesk, you can track issues, prioritize them and work with your team to resolve them faster.
Learn how to forward and convert your emails to tickets using Freshdesk here.

Agent Guide.title: Customising Ticket Forms
Agent Guide.description: Customize the ticket form to include different fields specific to the type of your business or your support process using Freshdesk. You can collect customer information that is unique to your business by creating custom fields for these details. Read more here!

Agent Guide.title: Working with the Ticket Details page
Agent Guide.description: Increase your agents' productivity by making use of all the features Freshdesk has to offer for your helpdesk workflow. Access customer data right within that customer's ticket, reply, notify, share solution articles, and collaborate with external stakeholders right from the ticket details page in Freshdesk. Read more here.

Agent Guide.title: Working with the Ticket List page
Agent Guide.description: The Tickets tab lets you filter out and view a list of tickets that you want to get working on. You can filter out tickets by source, type, status, agents assigned to, tags, products, and even the custom fields that you have created. Read more here.

Agent Guide.title: Sorting Ticket Conversations
Agent Guide.description: The order in which they see conversations within the ticket details page, be it chronological or reverse chronological, should be a choice that they make. Admins can enable their agents to view the newest conversations on top with a single click, so they don’t have to scroll down every time to find the latest updates on a ticket. Read more here.

Agent Guide.title: Working with Contacts & Companies
Agent Guide.description:
Freshdesk helps you keep track of all the customers reaching out to your helpdesk, letting you create and save them as contacts under the Customers tab. You would also be able to group specific contacts and map them to a company.


When a ticket is created by a new requester, a contact is automatically created in your helpdesk. These contacts can be seen in the Contacts tab.Read more here.

Agent Guide.title: Setting up the Feedback Widget
Agent Guide.description: Freshdesk lets you collect feedback and support requests directly from your website, portal or any third party web page. This lets your customers submit a ticket to your helpdesk without having to look around for your self-service portal or remember your support email. Read more here.

Agent Guide.title: Using Canned Forms
Agent Guide.description: Requests often come in with limited information and you might end up asking a set of repetitive questions to your customers. While replying, the customer would have to copy and paste the set of questions before they begin to answer them. Using Canned forms, you can now process these requests efficiently and with ease. These readily accessible form templates are customizable and help in resolving major service requests faster. Read more here.

Agent Guide.title: Creating a knowledge base article with Freshdesk
Agent Guide.description: Enable your team to create content based on customer feedback and help your customers find answers without any agent assistance using the Freshdesk Knowledge base. Read more about populating your knowledge base here.

Agent Guide.title: Setting up the help widget
Agent Guide.description:
With the help widget, you can embed solution articles and/or a contact form within your website or product. When your customers need help, they can open the widget to search through solution articles or to submit a ticket. 


To learn more about the help widget, you can

  • read our solution articles that will help you set up solution articles and a contact form in the help widget, embed it on your website, and configure advanced functionalities using the widget's APIs
  • watch a webinar which walks you through the basics of the widget
  • refer to our API documentation to make use of the advanced functionalities of the widget


Please note: Attachments don't work in Widget and Conversation Inbox.

Agent Guide.title: Managing your knowledge base with Freshdesk
Agent Guide.description: Save time managing your growing knowledge base content with the help of advanced filters, focused workspaces, and bulk actions. Read more about managing your knowledge base here.

Agent Guide.title: What has changed in Freshdesk Automations
Agent Guide.description: We've given the automations module a neat upgrade! Admins can now set up Dispatch'r, Supervisor, and Observer rules under one single module. Read more here.

Agent Guide.title: Automation - Rules that run on ticket creation
Agent Guide.description:
These rules allow you to setup your support workflows by performing a predefined set of actions on newly created tickets. These rules let you automate actions such as:

  • Assigning tickets to the right groups and/or agents

  • Setting ticket properties like status, priority, and type

  • Triggering email notifications to agents and requesters

  • Deleting tickets or marking them as spam

Agent Guide.title: Setting up a multilingual knowledge base with Freshdesk
Agent Guide.description: Translate your content into multiple languages and keep them updated  to enable your global customer base to find answers in their own language. Read more about setting up a multilingual knowledge base here.

Agent Guide.title: Approval workflow in the Freshdesk knowledge base
Agent Guide.description: With the new approval workflow, you can now customize the role of each agent involved in a review process, seamlessly track the status of articles in real-time, get instant notifications about a status update, and speed up the review process with bulk actions.

Agent Guide.title: Automation - Rules that run on hourly triggers
Agent Guide.description: Automation rules that run on hourly triggers (FKA time triggers) in Freshdesk allow you to bring your workflows into your helpdesk and define specific actions based on time and event-based triggers. With these automation rules, you can set up a simple rule to send out reminder emails automatically, if the customer hasn't gotten back with the information in, say, 48 hours.

Agent Guide.title: Automation - Rules that run on ticket updates
Agent Guide.description: Automation rules that run on time triggers in Freshdesk allow you to bring your workflows into your helpdesk and define specific actions based on time and event-based triggers.

Agent Guide.title: Thank you detector (powered by Freddy)
Agent Guide.description:
The Thank You Detector, powered by Freddy, can understand the intent of customer responses to 'resolved' or 'closed' tickets to decide if it should be reopened or not. Read more here.


This feature is now available as the Freddy Insights addon.

Agent Guide.title: Reordering Automation Rules
Setting up Scenarios
Agent Guide.description: Agents often need to perform a series of actions or tasks before they can push a ticket to the next level - tasks that are not unique to that ticket. For example, with tickets concerning refunds, you'd have to tag the ticket as Refund, assign the ticket to the Refunds group, and set the status of the ticket to Processing Refund. Scenarios in Freshdesk lets you perform a number of tasks with a single click, right from within a ticket. So every time there's a ticket about a refund, all you have to do is execute that scenario and the ticket is tagged, assigned and has its status changed without you lifting a finger. Read more here.

Agent Guide.title: Setting up an Email Outreach (Proactive Support)
Agent Guide.description: With Proactive Outreach in Freshdesk, your support teams can identify, understand, and reach out proactively to customers the moment they run into trouble, in turn creating a memorable brand experience for them. Read more here.

Agent Guide.title: Setting up your Sandbox
Agent Guide.description:
As a helpdesk administrator, you would want to test out a configuration or feature before enabling it on your Freshdesk account. For example, when you add a new workflow, you need to make sure it doesn't affect your customers or agents before you’ve had a chance to test and fine-tune it completely.


With the Sandbox feature, you can avoid making irreversible changes. The sandbox is a replica of your Freshdesk account. Read more here.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: Understanding Email Notifications
Help and Troubleshooting.description:
You can find Email notifications in the Workflows section on your admin page. They are helpful for generic scenarios like sending a notification when a new ticket is created or when a ticket is closed. 

For configuring customized email notifications based on ticket attributes, such as ticket type, group, source, requester name, and more, use the Automations feature. This is especially useful to route tickets to the right agent or group if your organization is spread across timezones, skills, and languages.


Watch this video to learn how to set email notifications up based on your organization or team's needs.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: What to Do if None of Your Emails are Getting Converted into Tickets
Help and Troubleshooting.description:
If none of your emails are getting converted to tickets, we've put together a few ways to go about fixing it yourself. First, you need to check if you're using a default email server and check if forwarding is set up for your mailbox. Then, ensure that your support email address and the Freshdesk forwarding email address are not the same.  

Watch this video to know how you can fix these issues.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: What to Do if Specific Emails are Not Getting Converted into Tickets
Help and Troubleshooting.description:
If specific emails are not getting converted into tickets, there could be a few issues behind the scenes. Two possible reasons are that the contact that sent the email could be deleted from Freshdesk or an automation rule is marking tickets as spam. 


Watch this video to know how you can fix these issues.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Send an Email Notification to an Agent when a Ticket is Created
Help and Troubleshooting.description: Agents and requesters can use their settings to receive email notifications when a ticket is created or acted upon. In this video, we'll show you how to send an email notification to the agent when a new ticket is created.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Skip New Ticket Notifications for Specific Scenarios
Help and Troubleshooting.description: Agents and CSMs can set up rules to prevent new ticket notifications from being sent depending on specific scenarios. In this video, we’ll show you how to skip new ticket email notifications in Freshdesk.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Set Up a Custom Mailbox
Help and Troubleshooting.description: There are two different ways of connecting email addresses to Freshdesk – default server and custom server. A default server lets you use Freshdesk servers to send and receive emails. A custom server allows you to use your own mail server to send and receive emails. In this video, we’ll show you how to set up a custom mail server in Freshdesk.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Automatically Send Emails to Requesters from a Specific Company
Help and Troubleshooting.description: Setting up custom email automations for specific scenarios when tickets are created or updated helps agents save time and meet unique requests. We’ll go through ticket creation first, and then ticket updates.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Automatically Inform Customers to Email a Different Support Address
Help and Troubleshooting.description: In this video, we’ll look at how we can create an email notification that automatically lets customers know that they need to email a different address. We’ll go through ticket creation first, and then ticket updates.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Automatically Convey SLA Expectations to High-priority Customers
Help and Troubleshooting.description: In this video, we’ll look at automating an email conveying the right SLA expectations for a high-priority ticket. We’ll go through ticket creation first, and then ticket updates.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Automate Emails to Requesters for Negative CSAT Surveys
Help and Troubleshooting.description: In this video, we show you how you can create a rule to automatically send out an email in response to a negative CSAT survey.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Update an Agent's Profile in Freshdesk
Help and Troubleshooting.description: In this video, we'll teach you how to update an agent’s profile based on your role as an agent, admin, or organization admin. Watch the video to learn more.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Delete Agents in Freshdesk
Help and Troubleshooting.description: Learn how to delete and restore Agents in Freshdesk.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Assign Tickets based on Keywords, Type, and Requester
Help and Troubleshooting.description: Learn how you can assign tickets to groups or the right agents based on certain unique scenarios to improve productivity. This video will walk through three different examples to help you understand the feature.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Automate Rules for Merged Tickets
Help and Troubleshooting.description: In this video, we’ll take a look at how Freshdesk detects merged tickets and how to perform various actions on these merged tickets using automations. Email notifications are usually sent when a ticket is resolved or closed, as are CSAT surveys.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Automatically Close Tickets after X Number of Days
Help and Troubleshooting.description: In this video, we show you how you can create a rule to automatically close tickets after a time period of your choosing.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Route Tickets to a Group Based on the Support Email Address
Help and Troubleshooting.description: You can assign all tickets coming to a particular configured email address directly to a group. For example, all emails received in your sales inbox can be assigned to the sales group. Watch the video to do so.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Export Reports and Widgets in Freshdesk Analytics
Help and Troubleshooting.description: In this video, we’ll take you through exporting reports from Analytics, as well as exporting widgets from within the report.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Group Tickets in Reports Based on a Category
Help and Troubleshooting.description: You can group tickets in your reports by various categories, like company, contacts, time period, statuses and custom or dependent fields. In this video, we'll show you how to group these together in a report.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to View, Filter and Export Underlying Data for Widgets in Freshdesk Analytics
Help and Troubleshooting.description: In this video, we'll take a look at how you can examine the underlying data for widgets in your report, edit the way they appear, filter them, and export them as a CSV or table.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Calculate Percentages for Metrics in Freshdesk Analytics
Help and Troubleshooting.description: In this video, we'll show you how you can compare or display your report's metrics in percentages.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Compare Metrics in Freshdesk Analytics
Help and Troubleshooting.description: In this video, we'll show you how to compare current helpdesk trends with the previous month’s data.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Export Reports
Help and Troubleshooting.description: In this video, we'll show you how to export reports and share them with your organization to showcase your helpdesk performance, and agent and customer analysis.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Set Up a Custom Report
Help and Troubleshooting.description: You can export the reporting data from Freshdesk regularly for use in your third-party reporting tool. Watch this video to know more.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Trigger a Daily Activities Export
Help and Troubleshooting.description: Every ticket in Freshdesk is being updated by requesters, agents or the system constantly. You can receive a daily report that contains all the activities that happened on the tickets. Watch the video to set it up for your helpdesk.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Add Widgets and Metrics to a Custom Report
Help and Troubleshooting.description: To create a custom report in Freshdesk Analytics, you need to add widgets and metrics. Watch the video to know more.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Add Filters to a Report
Help and Troubleshooting.description: Filters in reports help you drill down into a specific set of data and identify problem areas or derive insights. Watch this video to add filters to your reports.

Help and Troubleshooting.title: How to Make Changes to Curated Reports
Help and Troubleshooting.description: Curated reports are readymade reports available in Analytics. If your account is on the Estate or Forest plan, you can make changes to it to suit your workflow. Watch the video to learn more.
